snippet: If President Obama wins re-election, the historical memory of the race might turn on the role played by Hurricane Sandy.
abstract: FiveThirtyEight Blog; conservative pundits have already ascribed Pres Obama's poll gains to effects of Hurricane Sandy, but closer look reveals his momentum was already in place before storm, and probably has a number of distinct causes.
lead_paragraph: If President Obama wins re-election, the historical memory of the race might turn on the role played by Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: FiveThirtyEight - Factoring the Storm Into the Election
headline.main: Factoring Hurricane Sandy Into the Election Equation
headline.print_headline: Factoring Hurricane Sandy Into the Election Equation
